reviews.review_msg:
Don't listen to any of the negative reviews here, Yuri is an amazing professor. Her lectures are great, connecting course concepts into real world examples. You'll do well if you study and participate. She is hilarious and easily has the best fashion sense out of all profs, some of you need to take some notes. 

She won't hold your hand, grow up.

Terrible experience. The lectures lacked any meaningful information and it often felt like she just read off the slides without explaining the material. The exams were poorly writtenâ€”vague questions that didn't reflect what was covered in class. It felt like she didn't care about students or whether we understood the content. Avoid this professor.
she doesn't care about students and she also has a poor listening skill. grading criteria is hilarious. outside the class, she is not approachable at all
so hard and unfair

The actual work may have been ok but she didnt rlly care abt her students much. SUPER disorganized during the school strike as during those 3 weeks she didn't communicate to us that classes are cancelled for us. she also announced our exam ONE day before class. Overall the workload and difficulty is fine.

Was a strike during the semester, but prof made zero efforts to communicate with the class. Professor cancelled midterm day before the exam and sent an email the next morning saying it was back on. DO NOT waste time sending prof an email, she will not respond. Read the textbook to succeed on exams. Be prepared to learn all material on your own.

Participate in class and make sure she knows your name. You will do well if you come prepared to class with answers to her questions. The participation questions are more or less the same every week so its easy to prepare and have answers ready. Exams are also quite straightforward. No final, just two midterms

Wouldn't trust the reviews completely. Yuri knows her stuff and has lots of experience which is great to learn from. The deliverables for the class are simple and she gives grading criteria. The exams are easy to pass if you have read the cases and studied the slides. Straightforward 400-level class

Take the bad reviews with a pinch of salt. I found Yuri's class easy to do well in if you participate. The exams are simple and off the slides, not cumulative and only midterms so you are free after your last presentation. Read the cases and participate, and you will do well. Its a good class and I would take it again.

the course was poorly structured, with no clear learning objectives or course outline. The course schedule was constantly changing, which made it difficult to plan and keep up with the course requirements. The course materials were often disorganized, and the instructions were unclear.

Insightful. Enjoyed his lectures

1 midterm (solely on tb materials; mcq)
1 group project (30 pg+; pick team wisely)
A lot of memos (500 words; 12 cases)
2 individual assignments (20 pg+)

Participation matters; make or break your letter grade - just talk when you can

No final

Grading criteria not entirely clear

Anthony is a good professor, but assigns crazy amounts of work. Weekly 500-word memos two 3000-word assignments a 30-page report and a 90-question MCQ exam. Participation 20%! First assignment wasn't marked before the second was released + he stopped marking memos after 5th week. Disorganized and stubborn.

TAKE THE CLASS IF YOU LOVE WRITING ONLY!!

Class consisted of two individual written assignments, a group assignment, a final paper, and a weekly memo. At the end of the semester only the memos from the first two weeks of class were marked along with the first individual assignment. Very unreasonably workload which along with the lack of feedback, left many students demoralized.

Anthony is a great lecturer, he is able to clearly explain concepts and guide students to develop their own critical thinking through the use of HBR cases. However, throughout the span of the semester, we had a total of 14 assignments, of which we only received feedback on 3/14 by the end of the term, so no feedback for improvement.

workload is relatively lower for the course with anthony. easy-going, chilled professor and extremely helpful to students. midterm is easy, all mc-based. one team projects and indivdiual assignments should not be difficult if attend his classes regularly, plus the marking scheme is not that strict

Straight forward class. Complete work on time to be able to participate better in class. Anthony tries to make lectures as entertaining as possible. A lot of options of profs to take this course. I'd recommend Anthony if it fits with your schedule.

Anthony is a good prof who is very entertaining and passionate.  However this is a cap stone course with very low incremental value and the amount of work he assigns is obscene.  He assigns so many writings that all you do is try to get them done and do not learn anything.  If you have a very busy life find a different prof to take this with.
too many writings ; textbook is only used for Midterm (90 multiple choices)
Anthony was able to explain course material really well. He makes class more interesting with his jokes. Super approachable professor, and the coursework was fair.

Overrated. Learn no new material. He spends class reiterating cases that have been covered by someone else. Mark distribution for this class is ridiculous. Little guidance is provided on marking of assignments. Easy class but he makes a useless one to take.

This is probably one of the easiest profs for 478. Weekly memos, 2 papers, midterm, and a final report will consist of your marks. However this course has a really avg (80%) so it will be very hard to get above B+.

This is an easy course if taken from him BECAUSE THERE IS NOTHING IN IT.  He puts so much time into trying to be funny that he hardly teaches anything.  Take his class for an easy GPA boost but don't expect to learn.

Anthony is hilarious. He definitely made a night class more bearable. I really learned in his class. Very practical. His marking is pretty easy going. He likes to poke fun at people every now and then, which might annoy people, but it is all for good fun. Midterm: Super easy. All MC. Brings treats to share with class! Effective prof for sure!

Great prof - genuinely passionate about what he teaches. He makes presumably boring topics very interesting. Courseload was light, two easy quizzes, two short papers and two presentations. Would definetely recommend!
Great prof! 2 simple MCQ "tests" (with bonus marks!), two group presentations, and one group paper. You can pick your own groups.

Took him for strategy on a whim as there were no reviews for him yet at SFU, and what a pleasant surprise! Our grade structure is composed of two 25% "quizzes" (which are 50 very fair MC questions), participation, and two case studies. He cares about students learning, and engaging in the class is actually enjoyable. Would recommend.

Worst professor ever! She is very disorganized, disrespectful. She never provides clear instructions on assignments, she says one thing, but grades completely different. She forces people to participate, and if you don't, she will call you out.

If you are with a good group and you are interested in your group's research topic. Chances are you will get at least a B+, even A-. Some people think her lectures were boring, however, I deeply remember her point of 'complementary services', how to add value to a product by having a side service/product to accompany with.

Not the best prof for this course, did not do it justice. She is a pure academic, so a lot of what she preaches in class does not translate well over to real life. Her focus in class was mostly on her research, which was a disservice to us taking her course. Her expectations are very vague, and going to office hours barely helped clear anything up

Easiest prof for this class. super easy quizzes if you read text guaranteed perfect score, quizzes worth 22% . NO FINAL, group work worth 50% . Stay on top of stuff on a weekly basis and this is an easy A, do not cram for individual paper worth 22%. Super vague and biased marking criteria tho so do check in with her as you write your papers

She is nice and friendly. Be prepared to read the text for the quizzes but you will get almost full marks since she takes best 7 out of 8 quizzes, and the quizzes are very easy. Choose a good team since 50% of the marks are team discussion and 1 team paper. She gives marks easily since she knows this is a 4th year course. Overall's an easy class.

She does not give clear instructions or proper feedback. Grading scheme is vague. During case discussions has a "right"answer in her mind and if you don't agree with her you are in trouble. Very condescending and  patronizing.

Her instruction and timetable is the most confusing one i have ever seen. She never told you what she is expecting and supposed that you will know it. A lot of work and need a lot of time to "guess" what she is expecting.
Moderate speaker. Satisfactory text. But, very knowledgeable in the subject. You will come out of this class knowing ALOT. The most useful Business class I've taken at SFU.

Doesn't matter whether you spent 20 hours or 2 hours on your assignment, he grades almost every submission a B or B+ and provides almost no useful feedback (standard deviation for class grades is VERY small). He also goes on random useless tangents during lectures.

While BUS 478 is quite a boring class, Jerry puts effort in to try to make it a bit more engaging. He's a nice guy and is pretty understanding when you need help. His assignments are time consuming and can be difficult, and the grade ranges are odd and extremely small. This makes grading quite confusing given that it is a curved class.

He just reads off of the slides with an occasional anecdote. I didn't learn anything new in this class. Lots of group work, which was extremely frustrating. The grading felt very arbitrary, but considering this is a qualitative course (BUS478), I guess there's not much he can do about that. Overall, I wouldn't take it again with him again.

Solid choice for a prof! I really enjoyed his class as he made it bearable. I can see this class being a nightmare with other profs. He was super nice and lenient, always willing to help. The nature of the course is that you dont learn much, his templates to do the assignments are awesome! I would take him again in a heartbeat!

Jerry is a super nice prof and is very easygoing. The lectures are a mix of in-class activities (ungraded) and his lecture. The lectures are useless, as they don't have an impact on the assignments. Don't put in the effort because it probably won't be reflected in your grade. He seems to give every report the same grade (80%).

You won't learn much but that's the nature of a capstone course. Jerry is a solid choice for 478. Easy marker and a lot of little assignments that add up. Consistent workload throughout the term however the individual paper is what really distributes the curve.

Jerry is a nice guy but he doesn't know what he's doing most of the time. He mumbles and goes off tangent, so it's a waste of time going to class. But his midterm is straight forward and similar to the saple midterm. No need to use his textbook, just use his slides! You learn absolutely nothing from the class :)

Pros: Nice prof, easy going and not picky at all. Slides very useful for Mid-term Cons: expect to have a 20 pages individual paper, and, of course, 2 group papers. Basically, you can learn nothing from the class.
Tangents are funny. Notes are done for you. Good class.
Nice guy. Uses detailed grading sheet when he marks your papers which is helpful.
Enjoyed his lectures. Knows his stuff. Seems to care about his students. Fair marker.
Good prof. Definitely knows his stuff. Just an overall good guy vibe. :) *There's quite a bit of group work but the individual parts of the course are where the curve sets grades apart.

Wouldn't recommend Jerry. There are a lot of reports to write as well as a presentation. Midterm is relatively easy. However, he grades based on how he feels and is extremely inconsistent with his grading. His grading is unfair.
- Three papers (10 to 25 pages each) + 1 big midterm + 1 presentation - Learn nothing about Strategy. - Awful teaching skills. - Take it with someone else that u learn something.
Boring but really nice. Not a hard marker...but that could turn out to be bad, as everyone in the class gets high grade and pushes the average high

Really helpful and understanding. I was not able to finish an assignment that was worth 30% on time and he was willing to give me an 2-day extension. He also tells interesting stories in class, though they may be a little long. :)

Not using much practical experiences. Group presentation everyone will get a 3 no matter how hard you work. Generally will reply your email requests... I didn't learn anything new in this course to be honest.. I wanted someone very case based but it wasn't.

This class is taught more like a lecture than a case analysis course on strategy; a couple chapters are covered every week. If not for the stories, I'd probably fall asleep, as the lecture is a repeat of the textbook (which he co-authored). Not much feedback is given on why you got the mark that you did, and it seems arbitrary at times.
He is nice and easy to get a high mark.

He's great! Funny and kind. Will help out whenever he can. He will go out of his way to help you out. As well, very considerate and wants his students to do well. I laugh at those who complain about him...if you read their comments, half them can't spell...LOL it's a miracle they even made it up to his class level.
I thought Prof Jerry was good. He knew his stuff and tried to make it fun. I would take another class with him.
Enjoyed his class. He made it fun with his sometimes funny jokes. Nice guy.

Here's the thing about Jerry: His class is boring and you don't really learn anything, but it's pretty easy. Besides, no one learns anything new in 478 - it's just review of everything we've been taught over the last 4 years. Might as well take it with a prof who is more likely to give you a good mark!

if you think you're smart, take this course with him.  it's actually really easy.  doing well on the simulation's actually a piece of cake, and it's the only part of the course that actually matters (grade-wise).
No Comments
This prof doesn't do anything. Stops teaching after 1 month.  Don't need to show up except for midterm and presentation.  Arbitrary marking scheme and encourages you to play a computer game.
completely arbitrary marking scheme...he pulls numbers out of his a$$...the strategy game is a poor excuse for playing Lotto 649 with your grades. Enjoy!
Great prof, one of the few that I actually enjoyed sitting through the lecture. He has great insights and experiences that he loves to share.

Ed was a decent teacher. The assignment instructions usually lack depth but he answers emails in a timely matter. The exam was easy as he allowed an unlimited page cheat sheet. You are graded by a small amount of items so the course load didn't feel heavy. No group projects was a positive and he also gave a bonus mark quiz.

Ed DGAF! He does things his way and doesn't brook dispute of any kind.  Has some good content but spends way to much of lecture time talking about himself and how much he spends on consumer goods in a way that has nothing to do with the course content and is repetitive and irrelevant, teaching us only how insecure he is.

Edward is fine. His classes do not have lots of assignments. 2 papers (short paper maximum 2 pages, long paper maximum 4 pages).1 presentation, in-class short analysis assignment and midterm exam. No group work outside the class and final exam. Edward doesn't use canvas, the only way to contact Edward is sending him email.

Currently in the class. No grade yet. I honestly do not understand people who have rated him highly. There is no structure to the course. He has not set up canvas, readings come in a series of unorganized emails. He is outdated. Has no respect for the students in class. There is no learning environment. He talks at you for hours and enjoys it.

This was definitely the easiest Bus class I've ever taken. Some people hate Matadeen, but they just don't get his humor. He's sarcastic, offensive and bullying at times, but he's just trying to be funny. He's actually super nice. One important thing though: PLAY BALL. You're not going to agree with him on everything, just pretend you do!

I would definitely recommend Matadeen for this course. He is interesting and a great professor. His marking is fair and makes reasonable demands. He will tell you how to do well in the course and exactly follows through with what he says. He's pretty funny too.

I like the guy. He is funny and he knows he can teach... so I was never bored in his class. Someone mentioned that choise about the cases was unfair - I say you are just stupid! The idea is STRATEGY and god knows I loved the fact that I didn't have to write the second case! Allan is all around cool guy, friendly and nice to talk to. Keep it up Alla

One of the most intelligent professors in Business! students taking with him will learn more than just materials from the textbook, he can really broaden students' perspective! Class is fun! lots of examples! I recommend all good student wanting to be better should take class with Professor Matadeen!

When it comes time for 478 - take it with matadeen.  So STRAIGHT FORWARD.  You know exactly what to do, what to expect.  Do it, and you'll get a good grade.  Not to mention that he's hillarious.  Note that I HATED 207, but LOVED 478.  There's a certain amount of respect that he accords you once you've made it to 4th yr.
Super Easy... yo only need to write 1 case and that's 50%.  It is like all or nothing gamble.  No workload at all.  Who care if he is a jack or not!
Nice Prof!
No Comments
The best prof ever.
Take her! Super chill class with only a few assessments. 2 quizzes and a paper, very doable and manageable course load.

Daniela is a very nice and caring professor, however she is a tough grader. It is hard to get high marks on her exam and homework unless you have the exact detail that she is looking for. Overall, not a hard course but hard to get high grade!

I love Daniela!!! She is very considerate and patient. And always ready to help you with your assignment and group project. She provides many helpful ideas for our group project, and we can make improvements continuously before the deadline based on her comments and it is totally different from other prof I took! Take her course if you can!
Super nice prof. She's really caring and very willing to help students. Her class was very enjoyable and I would def recommend her to anyone who is taking Bus 478.

Rui was a really good prof, one of the best ones of Beedie. His lectures were amazing, I was locked in the entire 3 hours. He's really engaging and uses real world examples sos you understand the concepts. His exams were fair as well as the presentation.

THis is a work hard get A class. He is really open to questions and friendly. Participation makes a difference and make you stand out. Take notes during case study lectures. Great prof to ask for reference if you get A range. He gave me a reference letter for master application, as I got A- and participated so he knows me. got into dream school

Rui's a great prof and you get to learn a lot in his class. One key thing with his marking is that he has very specific things he wants to see in answers so make sure you pay attention in lectures for the quizzes and cases.

I found Rui very nice and engaging. His grading is fair & straightforward. Case analyses he has high expectations but every case is discussed thoroughly in class so after the first one you know exactly what he wants. Attend ALL lectures and write down what he says about certain examples, this will help you with test written questions. No surprises

Modified requirements (less emphasis on participation & grp proj) cause he knows it's tougher to collaborate these days. Probably one of the most doable 478 courseloads. Has very unique insights you wont get from the book, so it's important to listen to his lectures to do well. Amazing lecturer!! Way to cap off my BBA. Would highly recommend!
Probably the smartest prof I've ever had. Really lays out the material in a way that is easy to understand and applicable to the real world! Would recommend

Rui was one of my favourite instructors at SFU. Great person, captivating lectures, and teaches very relevant concepts in an engaging manner. If you have the chance to take BUS478 with him, do it! He's one of the best. As long as you follow along in class and read the textbook. you will be fine. His exams/assignments are very fair.

Rui is the best professor I have had at SFU. He provides engaging and thought provoking lectures with real business world applications that you can take into the workplace and other classes. Class attendance is mandatory for cases he goes over and exams are graded fairly. If you have a chance to take a class with this professor, definitely do it!

A great lecturer and provides good feedback. Using the textbooks for midterms is important. Attendance is mandatory because you need to be able to apply course concepts to each and every in-class case. Rui is available for advice for the case study and group project. Choosing good group members can be the make or break.
Rui has a very nice personality, always gives real-life examples in lectures. I felt like I really learned a lot of new information about companies and business worldwide.

Eloquent speaker that really gets you thinking. Super respectful prof who encourages questions and gives plenty of feedback to any comments/concerns raised in class. Summarizes key concepts well in each lecture. Exams are fair. Multiple choice is based off of the chapter readings. Attending class is a must for the cases that we go over in class.
Avoid this prof. if possible.....

Rui is by far the best professor I had at SFU. He is so knowledgeable and experienced in business. His lectures are engaging, they made me think deep. It was really great taking BUS 478 with him and I wished he taught more classes at SFU.

Very clear at explaining the broad picture for strategy. I would say this is one of the best professors I've had in the Beedie school of business as I found myself very engaged in each lecture. Weekly case analysis discussion for participation marks, midterm, final and a group presentation.

Rui is the best prod I have ever had at SFU. His strategy class is very interesting, I feel I learn something new every time. He has so many excellent points which always change my thinking. The exam is easy if you pay attention in the class. Highly recommended!!

Awesome.  Best prof I had at SFU.  Those that rated him poorly are probably accountants that dont understand strategy.  He teaches it very well and you will learn a lot.  If you find him hard it's because you dont understand basic strategy or are an accountant (same thing).
He can't explain clearly of how to do the papers and assignments.  And, he expects too much from them (you need to include every info and analysis that he wants).

The problem is that he's an Econ prof teaching a Bus course. What the hell is a rent? Answers lots of questions and wants to help, but course is just not set up for a Business mind frame. Took marks off my final for using TQM. Don't take this course with an Econ prof. Does not wrap up 5 years of BUS

Nice prof, tries to help. BUT: just loads you with TONS of assignments/readings that instead of learning you're just trying your best to finish the assignments. I was really looking forward to learning about strategic descision making, but didn't learn much as was scrambling to submit assignments!
Great prof. excellent lectures + fair marking.

Exteremely helpful prof.  Answers all email very throughly.  Never seen a prof answer emails so good.  However, he does have his shortcomings.  He marks assignments very hard.  And assignments are worth like 70% of grade
Really good professor IF you want to learn how to critically think. Those idiots who gave him bad marks are likely morons who blame their incompetance on others.
You guys are tough on Mark. He's actually a cool guy and teaches very well.
Marking scheme is not very balanced
marks hard
No Comments

Very nice guy. But his lectures are very boring and repetitive. Grading is assignment heavy. He doesn't really explain what he expects to see on the assignments and doesn't provide any feedback. Tests are all multiple choice, but far from easy.
Not bad

Karen was a great prof for 478! You dont need to study much if you show up to lectures and just listen to the cases as the final and midterm are very fair. Group work is only 25% of your grade so its much less than other 478 profs if you're not a fan of group work. Karen makes it really easy for students to do well if they want to!

I loved Karen as a 478 prof. Goes through PPT, then dives into a case for second half. Reinforces concepts (participation through discussion q's- helps you remember for exams). Final project (work hard!) because students are pretty smart to get into this class. If you want an enjoyable exp of 478, and learn (actually "learn"), take Karen!
Great prof, would definitely take again. explains everything clearly.
I took 478 with Adam 2 years ago and I am still laughing!!!

Adam is definitely passionate about teaching and I did throughly enjoy his class. However, he takes too much of a marketing approach to strategy. I understand that is his concentration but he neglects all other aspects. Furthermore, I wish he spent more time on admin - his expectations can get a bit confusing. But an easy grade nonetheless.

Adam is one of the best profs I've had. He is very enthusiastic about the course content and is willing to help students in any way he can. He makes classes feel fun and you will learn a lot - way more than in boring lectures. Take 478 with him if you can! You will be glad you did.
He's a keeper.
Very enthusiastic and fun professor. Treats students as business partners. Pretty hot too ;)

Adam is an incredible professor. He is passionate about teaching and will go to great lengths to motivate his students. Not only is he willing to go above and beyond for his students in the classroom, he is always more than willing to lend a hand in career guidance. Take his class, have fun and learn lots!

He is an awesome teacher and a person with golden heart. He knows his stuff very well.He is always passionate to teach and to help everybody. When you are in his class you don't need to worry about anything. He makes sure that each student understands everything. He will motivate you, he will support you. He will be there 4 u all the time.
Awesome prof! Very passionate and very helpful. If you don't take 478 with him you will regret it! Great experience overall!

Best pro ever, get his class no question ask. No weekly paper, 20 pages report stuff, just attend his lecture and have fun! that's it.. you will regret if you dont take it with him.. good luck if you take it with other profs, and have fun if you take it with him.. thats all i got to say!
Good prof!!!
I best prof in sfu!I like the way how he encourage students to think and talk in class. You can really learn something from him. Homework and exam are easy.
Good professor!
Best prof ever.

One of the best professors at SFU. Will do anything to help out his students and is extremely available for extra help. Makes dry material really interesting and keeps the class engaged. Made a boring class fantastic! Take any class with Adam and you will learn SO much.

Grading scheme made no sense. Went from calm to furious quickly. Ranted at class for not doing as well as he wanted on the midterm, but hadnt released grades yet and was ranting at students who showed up when attendance was not mandatory. Seemed insecure and that his grading was unfairly punitive based on how he felt about you as a person.

Lectures were online but had optional in person discussions. I went to every one and found them to be valuable. He gave many useful exam tips and helped me better understand the material, which can be a bit dry to just learn online. He's also a funny and nice guy, only gripe is that he doesn't give breaks, so it can be hard to stay focused.

I really enjoyed BUS 478 with Professor G! Due to COVID-19, the course was delivered online. All lecture videos were very well-made, informative, and available from the start of the term, so you can watch them at your own pace. MT and final were easy. Also, no group assignments! Prof G really cares about his students and wants them to do well.

Seems like his class was horrible when it was in person... but he restructured his class a LOT now that it's remote. 50% final 25% midterm on short answer questions that are identical to the discussion questions you got throughout the term (applied on different companies). he's real easy on the marking too. if you hate group work take it with him.

first of all, the CAPSTONE... something that you'll never be taught but somehow tested. MOST BS. breaks? don't even think about it. you have weekly presentations to do and only have an hour or so with your group to prepare, write, and make the presentation, and present while he's out. I have so much to write but no more space left. just STAY AWAY

Been in SFU for 6 years and have had my fair share of challenging professors/instructors but Eric is the most incompetent instructors and has zero capability to evaluate any of his student's knowledge. His weekly readings are around 4-5 articles and can be up to 50 pages long but tests on the most trivial details. Boring and monotone speaker, 0/10

By far one of the worst professors I have encountered during my time at SFU. Eric has an unclear and ambiguous grading scheme, and dishes out grades based on how much he likes you. He does not respect student's time as he goes overtime every lecture without consideration that people have other commitments and docks marks for you leaving.
Great professor when it comes to actually learning and critical thinking. Interesting lecturer and always willing to help.

Eric is one the best professors to listen to during lecture. He is insightful, and explains topics very thoroughly through the use of metaphors. He is a real gem if you approach him with questions about the topic and will take the time to help you.   The exams are straight forward as long as you study what he tells you to study.
Eric is smart but extremely disorganized, his lack of clarity and boring lectures make this class frustrating.  He also seems slightly biased with his marking for the presentation.

Have to read a lot of academic articles (every week there is 1 or 2). Boring lecture, speaks very lightly, he gets distracted by sounds, yes random sounds and pauses. Tests however were fairly simple, his lecture slides don't have much material, thus studying is quite easy. Not too much work other than the readings.
not help at all. if you get good marks on exam , you still will get C on this course because he marked people by his favour.
Lots of readings and work for project and exam but easy marker. Definitely recommend taking him for this class.
Good Prof, easy going, made Bus 478 a breeze. Case studies each week, one test and final project. Consider Eric.

Took 492/478 w/ him in 2008/09. The amt of work was pretty low and exams were easy (told us exactly what to study). It seemed like he graded presentations mostly based on effort. Not sure if that has changed. To me, he is one of the most entertaining, easygoing and intelligent professors at the school. He just likes to play Devil's advocate a bit.

Should NOT be teaching. He is not helpful, unless you are a "cool" boy. Participation is key, but he only lets those he likes speak (while turning his back to others and making faces when they do speak). He was and still is, an insecure nerd.
Way harder than any 478. Too much work demanded relative to other 478. Attandence is mandatory (If missed 3 classes => F automatically).

For BUS478, it was essentially a case comp class. One midterm, no final, two presentations, many discussions. Make sure to pick a good group. Hardest part is the midterm - make sure to be thorough and pace yourself. Matt marks tough too. Matt is a nice person but lectures can get a bit dull. Lots of bland discussions throughout the lectures too.
Matt is such a caring, knowledgable and funny professor. He really cares about students and wants them to succeed. Classes are very interactive and interesting.
Tough, but good. The class is very interactive, if you come prepared, you will do fine.
